Clément Haëck
PhD student @ LOCEAN, Paris

Experience

  • Research Engineer  2023 - 2025

    Laboratoire d'Océanographie et du Climat: Expérimentations et Approches Numérique (LOCEAN), Paris

    Planned to start after the end of my PhD, under a CNRS contract and financed by a CNES (Centre National d’Études Spatiales) project. Under the supervision of Marina Lévy (LOCEAN), I will further develop the methods established during my PhD.
  • Ph.D Student  2019 - estimated to end Feb. 2023

    Laboratoire d'Océanographie et du Climat: Expérimentations et Approches Numérique (LOCEAN), Paris

    Under the supervision of Marina Lévy (LOCEAN) and Laurent Bopp (ENS), I study the impact of oceanic fronts on phytoplankton growth and biodiversity, from satellite products.

Education

  • Master of Science (Master 2) - Fluids Mechanics,  2018 - 2019

    École Polytechnique and Sorbonne Université

  • Bachelor of Science (Licence 3) - PhyTEM (Physics, Theory, Experiment, Model)  2016

    École Normale Supérieure Paris-Saclay

    Short presentation

Teaching

  • Numerical Physics - Projects  2021 - 2022

    Sorbonne Université

    I supervised student projects in numerical physics in Python, at BoS level (L3, 60h).
  • Numerical Physics - Introduction  2020 - 2021

    Sorbonne Université

    Introductory course to numerical physics in C++, at BoS level (L3). I gave lessons and supervised TD, TP and projects (60h).

Internships

  • Master thesis internship  2019 (6 months)

    LOCEAN

    Under the supervision of Marina Lévy, Study of interactions between oceanic currents and diversity of phytoplankton from satellite products
  • Pre-doctoral research year abroad (ARPE)  2017 - 2018

    IFISC (Institute for Cross-Disciplinary Physics and Complex Systems), Universitat de les Illes Balears, Palma de Mallorca, Spain

    Under the supervision of Cristóbal López, I studied numerically the application of network theory and dynamical systems tools to the advection of tracers in oceanic flows
  • Research internship  2017 (5 months)

    LIFE (Laboratory for Fluid-Structure Interaction) at Universitat Rovira i Virgili, Tarragona, Spain

    Under the supervision of Francisco Huera-Huarte and Sukruth Satheesh, I studied experimentally the effect of free surface on a flat plate translating perpendicular to the flow
  • Research internship  2016 (1 month)

    PMMH (Physic and Mecanics of Heterogeneous Mediums) at ESPCI (École Supérieure de Physique et de Chimie Industrielles de la ville de Paris), Paris

    Under the supervision of Ramiro Godoy-Diana and Marion Segall, I studied experimentally the flow around head of snakes models underwater under acceleration to put in evidence morphologic differences between species

Skills

  • Languages

    French (mother tongue), English (C2 Certification of Cambridge)

  • Programming languages

    Python, Fortran, Bash, Git, Latex, C++
